locations.name: Dunkin'
locations.guide:
Customize your coffee

When ordering coffee drinks, hold the sugar and ask for nonfat milk instead of cream or whole milk. If you want to add some flavor, Dunkin' Donuts offers about a half dozen sugar free flavors - try adding one!

Slim sandwiches

They may be named after their donuts, but Dunkin' Donuts offers some great lower calorie breakfast sandwiches. The Egg White Flatbread and Egg & Cheese English Muffin sandwiches each clock in with 300 calories or less. For even fewer calories, try a slim 150-calorie Wake Up Wrap.

Smart sweets

If sweet is more your style at breakfast, try the Oatmeal with Dried Fruit Topping. If it's gotta be a donut, stick with a 260-calorie glazed yeast donut or a couple 70-90 calorie Munchkins.

locations.name: Chick-fil-A
locations.address: Student Center East, 750 South Halsted Street, Chicago
locations.guide:
Go grilled

To keep calories and fat in check, stick with grilled chicken. The Grilled Market Salad, Grilled Chicken Cool Wrap, Grilled Chicken Sandwich, and Grilled Nuggets all clock in with less than 350 calories.

Add fruits and vegetables

Pair your chicken with a Side Salad or Fruit Cup instead of Waffle Fries, Coleslaw, or soup. You'll save calories and get a healthy dose of fruits or veggies.

Be breakfast savvy

Skip the fatty fried chicken, bacon or sausage bagels, biscuits, and burritos and order a Greek Yogurt Parfait or Multigrain Oatmeal instead.

locations.name: Wendy's
locations.guide:
Stick with Jr. size

Getting a burger? Stick with a fewer-than-400-calories Jr. size.  If it's a Frosty you're fantasizing about,  a Jr. size will cost you about 200 calories. That ain't bad.

Choose grilled chicken

For salads, sandwiches, and wraps, choose lean grilled chicken over fried. 

Make a meal out of sides

Pair an order of Rich & Meaty Chili or Baked Potato (hold the cheese) with a Garden Side Salad for a filling meal with around 500 calories.

locations.name: Subway
locations.guide:
Subway is a great place for a protein rich meal on the go. If you follow some of these tips you will satisfy your sandwich craving with a big nutritional punch!

Pile on the veggies

Subway lets you add as many veggies as you want at no additional charge! This is a great way to add more nutrients to your sandwich.

Go light on the spreads

Choose light mayo or skip mayo all together and save 50-100 calories. Add some zest with mustard or honey mustard instead.

Choose sweets carefully

Choose apples or a yogurt parfait instead of cookies if you're looking for a sweet ending to your meal.

locations.name: Jimmy John's
locations.guide:
Slim Subs

Skip the high calorie Giant Club Sandwiches and go for a Plain Slim instead. Your best bets are the Slim Roast Beef and Slim Turkey Breast which clock in with less than 500 calories each. Ask them to add lettuce and tomato to add an (almost) calorie free crunch. Plain Slims too plain? Try the Big John or Turkey Tom subs for only about 50-100 calories more.

The Unwich

Cut even more calories (and carbs!) by ordering your sub as an Unwich. They'll swap the bread for a lettuce wrap, saving you 280 calories.

Smart Side

Gotta have chips with that sandwich? A bag of Thinny Jimmy Chips will only add 130 calories to your meal.

locations.name: Starbucks
locations.guide:
Caffeine is a morning necessity for millions worldwide. If you’re not a fan of drinking your coffee black or espresso straight, try these suggestions to skim calories, fat, and sugar from your beverage of choice.

Make your latte “skinny”

Lose the whip and substitute nonfat milk  in your latte to cut fat and calories. Lose the sugary syrups and pump up the flavor with the sugar-free versions instead. 

Downsize

If you can't resist that Caramel Macchiato or Vanilla Latte, stick to a modest Tall or Short size to indulge for fewer calories.

Snack smart

For a healthy breakfast on-the-go, try the Whole-Grain Oatmeal, Reduced-Fat Turkey Bacon Breakfast Sandwich, or the Spinach & Feta Breakfast Wrap. Looking for a snack? Satisfy your sweet tooth with seasonal fruit or a Greek yogurt parfait.  If you need something a bit more substantial to battle the afternoon hunger, try the Protein Bistro Box.

locations.name: Papa John's
locations.guide:
Load up on veggies and keep it light on the meat

Avoid fatty meats and go for veggie toppings instead. The more veggies the better, but if you want to include some meat on your next slice avoid high calories options like pepperoni and sausage and choose Canadian bacon or chicken instead.


Stay thin

A thinner crust means fewer calories per slice.


Light Cheese

Order your next pizza with light cheese - less calories but all the flavor!

locations.name: Panera Bread
locations.guide:
Better Breakfast

Skip the muffins, scones, and pastries and grab a hearty bowl of Steel Cut Oatmeal. Not an oatmeal fan? Try the Strawberry Granola Parfait, Seasonal Fruit Cup, or any of the three Breakfast Power Sandwiches.

Think Thin

Trim the calories from your bagel and schmear with a thin Sprouted Grain Bagel Flat topped with a reduced-fat cream cheese spread. 

Veg Out

With over a dozen salads on the menu, it’s easy to get your veggies at Panera. Most full-size salads clock in with only around 500 calories, so munch on! If it’s gotta be a sandwich, try pairing just half a sandwich with a salad as a You Pick 2 combo.

locations.name: Buffalo Wild Wings
locations.guide:
Go Naked

Skip the deep-fried Traditional Wings, Boneless Wings, and Chicken Tenders. Try the grilled Naked Tenders instead - 4 pieces clock in with only 170 calories.

Splurge on Salad

Load up on veggies and keep calories in check with a Garden Chicken Salad topped with grilled or blackened chicken. 

Smart Sides

Skip the high-calorie fries, onion rings, and chips and pair a Side Salad or carrot and celery Veggie Boat with your Naked Tenders.
